subject: AI & Agents
title: Explicit vs Implicit Feedback
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Explicit vs Implicit Feedback.

hook.text: Star ratings feel obvious. But 90% of users never rate anything. Now what?

buildup.text: Explicit feedback: ratings, reviews, likes. Implicit: clicks, views, time spent, purchases.

discovery.text: Implicit feedback is abundant but noisy. A click doesn't mean they liked it.

twist.text: A user watching 10 seconds of a video is negative signal. Watching 10 minutes is positive.

climax.text: Modern systems rely heavily on implicit signals because explicit feedback is too scarce.

quiz.question: Why do modern recommenders prefer implicit feedback?
